column5: Hello all.  The tentative date for the Cobourg fish lift is this weekend, Saturday March 26 starting at 8 AM.  Directions to location: https://www.google.ca/maps/place/The+Mill+Restaurant+%26+Pub/@43.975321,-78.183197,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x79c3b1a9b5802f44 I will update this thread by Wednesday to confirm dates.
Hey all.  It is a go for this weekend.  Hope to some of you there.  Cheers...
what is the fish lift? I will be in Cobourg this weekend doing some fishing.. any tips for spots (no boat, just fishing from land!)?

what is the fish lift? I will be in Cobourg this weekend doing some fishing.. any tips for spots (no boat, just fishing from land!)?  Volunteers help net and lift 200 rainbow trout over an impassible dam.
Unleash your inner loogan--have FUN-Cool Experience  Happy Easter

Glad to see they are getting at least a chance to spawn !!! It's too bad they can't remove that ancient mess of a broken dam !!!!! Thanks to the volenteers ..... I used to do it many years ago in bommanville over the vanstone dam !!!

Glad to see they are getting at least a chance to spawn !!! It's too bad they can't remove that ancient mess of a broken dam !!!!! Thanks to the volenteers ..... I used to do it many years ago in bommanville over the vanstone dam !!!  the mnrf has been trying to negotiate a deal with the land owner to put in a fishway .. going on 3 years now with no progress
I went! and Loved IT! When we were young, scooping minnows with a net was fun! This is 1000X more fun.

I went! and Loved IT! When we were young, scooping minnows with a net was fun! This is 1000X more fun.  Great meeting you today.  You know what would be more fun? Actually targeting them with rod and line        Mike
Yes it was a great day some real nice fish got pulled to pass on their genetics,  awesome to meet you Mike!
Nice to meet you Mike. Awesome pics as usual.  Some of these fish were size of Chinooks.
Cotton glove, oh no. Going to lose it,s tail. LOL  Great job guys.
